intro: Hornungia alpina subsp. auerswaldii, commonly known as the alpine hornungia, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family, and is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically thrives in nutrient-poor, rocky soils and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. Its leaves are alternate and often have a distinctive ribbed or corrugated appearance. The species is notable for its ability to survive in extreme climates, making it an important component of alpine and tundra ecosystems.
